Name: Breathe, You Are Alive
Description: We are a small sangha that meets weekly to practice sitting meditation followed by a few mindful movements, read a short text and share what’s in our hearts. We find that this regular practice brings us solidity and joy in our everyday lives. For more information please check our website.

Name: Cahaba River Sangha
Description: Dharma book club

Name: Cedar Cabin Sangha
Description: Our sangha has practiced more than 20 years ago and continues weekly in downtown Ithaca, NY.   In 2002, we began our practice in the Plum Village tradition. Each week we come together in person in a friendly, welcoming gathering to share songs, guided meditations, walking meditation, readings, silent meditation, a tea ceremony and dharma sharing. We meet alternate weeks on Zoom + in person. All are welcome.

Name: Chanting Sangha
Description: Chanting

Name: Chanting Sangha
Description: Chanting

Name: Chrysanthemum Sangha
Description: For friends who identify as LGBTQIA+

Name: Chrysanthemum Sangha
Description: For friends who identify as LGBTQIA+ & allies

Name: Compassionate Presence Mindful Community
Description: I was introduced to a local Plum Village tradition Sangha in 2009. After several years of practicing with that sangha I started the Compassionate Presence Mindful Community. We have both an online and in person gatherings. At both gatherings we practice the teachings of our dear Thay working to bring peace and reduce suffering through his teachings. Please see our website for details regarding times and dates of our gatherings plus general information about our practice.

Name: Deep Listening Sangha (audio only)
Description: Guided meditation

Name: Dharma Bell Sangha
Description: We sit and share some of Thay's teachings, such as working through a book together. We then meditate on what we have heard and enjoy a time of dharma sharing at the end. The link for these sessions is posted on the Dharma Bell Sangha page, usually the day before the sitting. Attending these practices does not tie you into anything, there are no conditions, expectations, obligations, or requirements and, best of all, there's no fee! They are simply offered to support us all to progress in our path.

Name: Direction Home Sangha
Description: A space for Mental Health Professionals. We will meet on Sept 13, Oct 10, Nov 8 and Dec 13 at the listed time. Please inquire for more information!

Name: Earth Holder Community Ireland
Description: The Earth Holder Community is a branch of the Plum Village tree that applies Thay’s core teachings on engaged Buddhism, mindful living, social and racial justice, and inter-being with Mother Earth at this time of ecological crisis. We practice with the aims of bringing mindfulness, compassion, healing and nonviolence to protecting ourselves, one another, all beings and the Earth. We meet online on the First Sunday of the month, as part of the Sangha na Saoirse, Sunday morning weekly meetings. Typical online EHCI gatherings includes a guided meditation, a reading or recording from Thay's teachings on earth holding and interbeing, walking mediation and dharma sharing. These gatherings are open to all. You are very welcome to join us from anywhere in the world.

Name: Earth Holder Sangha
Description: Growing our love for Mother Earth

Name: Ecodharma Study – World Interbeing Sangha
Description: We explore deep ecology, focusing on the nature, our environment and the climate crisis.

Name: Equanimity Sangha
Description: 5 Mindfulness Trainings Recitation & Dharma Sharing

Name: First Light Sangha
Description: Friends coming together to practice, study & share (new friends welcome)

Name: Flower Fresh Sangha
Description: silent meditation

Description: silent meditation

Name: Flowing Waters Sangha
Description: We are a friendly group of meditation practitioners dedicated to living an engaged Buddhist practice in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. When we gather, we share a guided meditation, 30 minutes of silent sitting or walking, followed by a time of dharma sharing and reflection. We also recite the Five Mindfulness Trainings together.

Name: For Pre-Aspirants, Aspirants & Order Members
Description: 14 Mindfulness Trainings Recitation & Dharma Sharing

Name: Free Street Sangha
Description: Free Street Sangha is an inclusive community movement uniting body, speech, and mind to support individual and collective wellbeing. Welcoming all, it encourages open-hearted practice, active listening, and compassionate response, fostering a nourishing environment that helps participants manage life’s challenges and pursue peace, happiness, and healing together.

Name: Gentle Hearts Sangha
Description: This is an online Sangha with links to Stream Entering/ Nhap Luu Monastery in Victoria Australia. Following the Health Practitioners Retreat at Stream Entering Monastery in February 2023, several participants expressed the desire to remain connected in the community, so that we can support each other in our work and lives caring for others, drawing on the wisdom of Plum Village practices. Our aim is to inspire each other to practice based in the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh. Join us and embrace a journey of resilience and shared wisdom, continuing your path with a community that values your dedication to helping others. Zoom link shared on the Facebook group.

Name: Happy Teachers Together Sangha
Description: For educators & other adults in the education ecosystem

Name: Healing Together Sangha
Description: For all healthcare practitioners

Name: Heart of the Valley Mindfulness Practice Center
Indian – Ahimsa Trust Sanghas
Description: A practice community of mostly Indian friends with a number of regular online meetings. Please visit website for details.

Description: Mindful eating is included on Tuesdays

Name: Interbeing Study – World Interbeing Sangha
Description: Focus on Thich Nhat Hanh's teaching of Interbeing---the fundamental interconnectedness of all things

Description: For children, teens and adults coordinated by wake up schools

Name: International LGBTQIA+ Sangha
Description: For friends who identify as LGBTQIA+

Name: Island of tranquility
Description: A collaboration with "wisdom of aging". Aimed for elderly people

Name: Karuna Garden Sangha
Description: Karuna Garden Sangha is an inclusive, peer-led online community where practitioners of all levels come together to practice meditation, share Dharma, and support each other's growth. We offer a welcoming space for individuals to explore and contribute to our collective mindfulness practice in a safe and supportive environment.

Name: Lakeside Buddha Sangha
Description: Strong meditation practice.  Contact Jack before coming.

Name: Leeds Interbeing Sangha
Description: Studying 'The Art of Living' and other books by Thay

Name: Living Christ Sangha
Description: An interfaith sangha practicing in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh

Name: Living the 14 Sangha
Description: Living the 14 Sangha The 14 Mindfulness Trainings are the foundation of the Order of Interbeing and we are strengthening our commitment to them by looking deeply at a single training each week.  We are open to OI members, Aspirants and pre-Aspirants. Each week is a study in itself. You are welcome anytime, week to week. Wednesdays, 7:30-9 PM ET on zoom.

Name: Los Angeles Compassionate Heart Sangha
Description: We are a hybrid Sangha, practicing simultaneously locally in Los Angeles and online via Zoom. For our Zoom ID and passcode, please send a brief email to lachsangha@yahoo.com.

Name: Lotus Bud Sangha
Description: We are a sangha in the Plum Village tradition, our teacher is Vietnamese Zen Buddhist monk Thich Naht Hanh (Thay) who passed away in January 2022. Thich Naht Hanh is one of the most prominent spiritual teachers of the 20th century. He was a peace activist, poet, author and most importantly a sangha builder. His teachings about mindfulness are unsurpassed. Lotus Bud Sangha was established by our dear Vietnamese dharma teachers in the 1980s who wanted to share this practice with the Vietnamese community and the wider Australian community. From those small but powerful beginnings we have a number of lay sanghas in Sydney and now our own meditation centre Mountain Spring Monastery at Bilpin.We would love to have you practice with us. What is practicing you may ask? In our sangha (community of meditators) we practice sitting and walking meditation, learn about the dharma (Buddhist teachings) and share about our experiences on the path of practice. We welcome beginners and experienced meditators as we learn from each other wherever we are in our practice. The group of regular facilitators at Lotus Buds are experienced meditators in the Plum Village tradition. We have been taught and guided by dharma teacher John Barclay who received the lamp transmission from Thich Nhat Hanh. John has been leading the sangha for many years, by teaching the dharma and mentoring many of us. He is also a Buddhist scripture teacher to primary and secondary students in Sydney. Meditation can be challenging at times however being in a sangha supports our practice and makes it easier. Being in a sangha with friends with shared values and a shared practice brings us joy and gives us energy. With weekly practice and spiritual friendships the path becomes easier and more beautiful. Each Thursday we practice sitting and walking mediation, recite trainings, or explore a teaching and share our reflections. Most importantly we learn about how meditation and the Plum Village practices can help us in our daily lives. Thich Nhat Hanh’s teachings help us to transform our suffering so we can become more peaceful and happy. Wherever you may be in your meditation practice you are welcome to join us.

Name: Lotus Pond Meeting - World Interbeing Sangha
Description: Dedicated to art in all of its forms as a part of our mindfulness practice.  Creators and enjoyers of art are equally welcome.

Name: Lotuses in the Mud Sangha
Description: For family and beloveds of those in recovery

Name: Midwest Moon Sangha
Description: An online and in person mindfulness practice center in the Plum Village Tradition meets everyday except Sunday

Name: Mindful Activism - World Interbeing Sangha
Description: Deepen your understanding/aspiration of the engaged aspect of the Plum Village tradition

Name: Mindful Leadership Sangha
Description: We practice together and explore mindful leadership topics

Name: Mindful Parenting – World Interbeing Sangha
Description: For parents looking deeply into parenting as a practice

Name: Mindfulness in Healing
Description: Developing mindfulness through compassionate listening and loving speech; join us for support in your healing experience and your life

Name: Morning Sun Sangha
Description: Morning Sun Sangha meets bi-weekly on Thursday. Starting times alternate month to month: 16:00 CET in November 2024, 17:00 CET in December 2024, 16:00 CET in January 2025, 17:00 February 2025.

Name: Mossy Path Sangha
Description: We practice for one hour on Sunday mornings with an up to 30 minute guided meditation, Touching the Earth, and a rotation of dharma sharing, sutra reading, tea ceremony, and 5 Mindfulness Trainings reading and discussion

Name: Muddy Path Sangha
Description: A therapeutic art community; members are welcome to participate or observe

Name: Nanaimo Buddhist Meditation Group
Description: Established in 2003, we meet every Saturday at 10 am to 12 pm in Nanaimo BC, Canada. Due toCovid, we practice on Zoom (i.e. online) at this present time.

Name: Neurodivergent Sangha
Description: Neurodivergent Sangha offers a safe and reliable space where you can express and liberate what you’ve been hiding without the fear of discrimination. Embracing neurodiversity through mindful connection, we provide spiritual support with Thich Nhat Hanh Tradition Plum Village's Practice. Our practices include Guided Meditation, Deep Listening, and Contemplative Exercise, helping you accept differences, build confidence, and achieve peace of mind. Join us to experience a community that values acceptance and spiritual growth.

Name: New Dawn Sangha
Description: Virtual meetings of the New Dawn Sangha

Name: New Dawn Sangha
Description: Virtual meetings of the New Dawn Sangha

Name: New Dawn Sangha
Description: Virtual meetings of the New Dawn Sangha

Name: Ocean Zen Community of Mindfulness
Description: Semi-guided meditation with Gathas for 25min, opening with 3 bells, closing with 2

Name: Ocean Zen Community of Mindfulness
Description: 5 Mindfulness Trainings, once a quarter; contact for next date

Name: One Love One Heart Sangha
Description: 5 Mindfulness Trainings Recitation and Touching the Earth

Name: One Love One Heart Sangha + Yen Tu OI Family
Description: 14MTs Recitation + Shared reflections for 5MT friends practicing inclusivity and belonging for all beings - contact for next date and time

Name: Oxford Thich Nhat Hanh Sangha
Description: Guided meditation

Name: Pacific North West Based
Description: 14 Mindfulness Trainings Recitation & Dharma Sharing

Name: Peace in Our Hearts Mindfulness Practice Circle
Description: This practice is inspired by the teachings and wisdom of the Vietnamese Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh and the Plum Village Tradition of Engaged Buddhism. We respect and encourage diversity and welcome you with all identities you hold. We begin with 45 minutes of sitting and walking meditation. After a short break, we will enjoy a talk, or a reading followed by group sharing (dharma sharing) about our mindfulness and meditation practice and how it influences our daily life and our interactions with the world around us. We acknowledge and pay gratitude to the Tilhini-Northern Chumash people on whose ancestral and unceded land we hold our practice. You can find our zoom link here: https://zoom.us/j/941753722?pwd=RjBOQUlBYWVYUUZXdU9zdnFrZU5qZz09#success

Name: Peaceful Presence Sangha
Description: For friends living with anxiety and/or depression

Name: Peaceful Shores Sangha
Description: Meets weekly as a group of committed Plum Village practitioners looking for connection and support. Leadership rotates, so the exact format of the gathering varies based on the leader's discretion. It typically includes a sitting meditation, reading, Dharma sharing, recitation, and discussion of the Five Mindfulness Trainings, walking meditation, viewing of Dharma talks by Thay or other monastics, and even mindfulness-based art projects. We also have a time to check-in with each other, sharing tea and small treats.

Name: Plumline
Description: Friends supporting sangha in the plum village tradition

Name: Queer Aspirations Sangha
Description: For Trans/Non-binary/Gender-Queer/Gender-Questioning/Intersex people with Monastic Aspiration. Even if your aspiration is very small, has lots of doubts, or is in the past - you're welcome to join! We primarily get together to share about our experience of having an aspiration that may not be available to us as our Truest selves. Open to hearing both the pain as well as the joys of potential exciting possibilities! This space is only for those who fit the above description – it is currently not for allies. Please email with your interest and confirming that you meet the description – and then you can find out when our next meeting is.

Name: Racial & Intersectional Justice – World Interbeing Sangha
Radiant Heart Sangha
Description: For friends struggling with issues of sexual misconduct, and ready to embrace personal change through the Plum Village tradition

Name: Rainbow Sangha Ireland
Description: For friends who identify as LGBTQIA+, curious or questioning - and in the spirit of celebrating inclusivity & cultural diversity we welcome people from all identities, cultures and countries, and members from all traditions or no particular tradition

Name: Red Kite Zen Sangha
Frequency: various days and times each month
Description: Red Kite Zen is a simple zen meditation and mindfulness group open to everyone - from beginners to more experienced - all are welcome - please visit our website for more info or to join our invite list

Description: Friends coming together to practice, study & share

Description: For friends with neurodivergence / mental health challenges

Name: Slowly Ripening Zoom Sangha
Description: Friends coming together to practice, study & share

Name: Smiling Sitters Sangha
Description: Neurodiversity Sangha. Meetings are held on Zoom as it allows people to attend with camera off and to feel safe until they are ready to show their faces. It takes some people months to get to that level of safety. Joining involves a brief chat to explain how we function and to make sure it is a good match. You can use the provided email to contact us initially.

Name: Spring Creek Sangha
Description: Typical Sangha gatherings include a dharma talk or teaching (read or viewed on video), joyful sitting, walking and guided meditation, and dharma sharing. Music (practice songs and chants), mindful movement and nervous system regulation practices may also be featured, as well as regularly scheduled recitation of the Five Mindfulness Trainings. Please email for specific weekly schedules and offerings. We were originally a local in- person sangha formed to serve Blue Cliff Monastery practitioners but now our small and dedicated online sangha serves practitioners from various locations.

Name: Still Water Kent Island
Description: Weekly meeting in Plumline Tradition.  All are welcome

Name: Still Waters Sangha
Description: 5 Mindfulness Trainings Recitation & Dharma Sharing

Name: Stockport Sangha
Description: Stockport Sangha welcomes new members. Open Meditation Every Thursday. Read 5 mindfulness trainings every second Sunday in month. Days of Mindfulness in Jan, May and Sep. Online only but based on Stockport area of UK

Name: Sugarloaf Mountain Mindfulness Community
Description: Meets 2nd Friday of each month, practicing in the Plum Village Tradition.  All are welcome

Name: Total Relaxation & Healing Sangha
Description: For friends suffering high stress and anxiety

Name: Trusting Hearts Sangha
Description: We are a Valencia-based sangha, rooted in the teachings of Thich Nhat Hanh and the Spirit Rock tradition of Vipassana. Gathering monthly, we come together to honor the Three Jewels: the Dharma, meditation, and the sangha. Each meeting offers a space for stillness, reflection, and connection, including Dharma sharing and the gift of deep listening. Sharing is always invited but never required. Our circle is open to all—come as you are, and be warmly welcomed.

Name: White Awareness Sangha UK
Description: Second Sunday each month. An opportunity for sangha members who have been socialised as/identify as ‘white’ – and would be interested in practicing together and reflecting on what this means in a racialised society, in an open, compassionate space of deep listening and loving speech. UK-based, however we welcome people from anywhere.

Name: White Clouds Sangha
Description: Meets online for mindfulness and meditation every Thursday evening from 7pm to 8:30pm.

Name: Wild Rose Sangha
Description: Silent meditation

Name: Wise Elders Sangha
Description: We long term Plum Village practitioners think about “what now”? How do we as elders continue our Beloved Thay’s Legacy? As we grow in years & wisdom we have an opportunity to BE & offer our practice, knowledge and experience. We welcome everyone over 65 - please join us.

Name: Young Adults (Wake Up)
Description: A community of young practitioners, aged 18-35, coming together to practice mindfulness in order to take care of ourselves, nourish happiness, and contribute to building a healthier and more compassionate society
